meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an autocrat.
meanings.sent1: The autocratic leader made all the decisions without consulting anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The autocratic ruler demanded complete obedience from his subjects.
meanings.sent3: The autocratic cat ruled over the house, deciding when everyone should eat.
meanings.sent4: Her autocratic control over the project stifled creativity and innovation.
meanings.sent5: The autocratic teacher's strict rules made the classroom feel oppressive.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a ruler who has absolute power.
meanings.sent1: The autocratic king's word was law in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Living under an autocratic regime meant limited personal freedoms.
meanings.sent3: The autocratic squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the tree for itself.
meanings.sent4: The autocratic storm unleashed its full fury on the small town.
meanings.sent5: The autocratic CEO controlled every aspect of the company with an iron fist.

meanings.definition: Characterized by absolute rule or authority.
meanings.sent1: The autocratic government silenced any dissenting voices.
meanings.sent2: The autocratic policies of the dictator oppressed the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The autocratic sun dictated when the flowers would bloom in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The autocratic referee's decisions were final and unquestionable.
meanings.sent5: The autocratic atmosphere in the room made everyone feel uneasy.
